de.weltraumschaf.ebnf.ast.visitor
Class TextSyntaxTree

java.lang.Object
  de.weltraumschaf.ebnf.ast.visitor.TextSyntaxTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
Visitor
public class TextSyntaxTree
extends Object
implements Visitor

Generates an ASCII formatted tree of the visited AST Syntax node. Example: The file rules_with_literals.ebnf will produce 

 [syntax]
  +--[rule='literal']
      +--[choice]
          +--[sequence]
          |   +--[terminal=''']
          |   +--[identifier='character']
          |   +--[loop]
          |   |   +--[identifier='character']
          |   +--[terminal=''']
          +--[sequence]
              +--[terminal='"']
              +--[identifier='character']
              +--[loop]
              |   +--[identifier='character']
              +--[terminal='"']
For generating the tree lines a two dimensional array is used as "render" matrix. The text is lazy computed by computing the array field column by column and row by row.

Author:
Sven Strittmatter

Returns:

beforeVisit

public void beforeVisit(Visitable visitable)
If as Syntax node comes around the visitor will be initializez. Which means that the depth property is read, the matrix and level properties will be initialized. All other Node types increment the level property.

Specified by:
beforeVisit in interface Visitor
Parameters:
visitable - Visited node.

visit

public void visit(Visitable visitable)
Generates the string contents in the row of the visited node.

Specified by:
visit in interface Visitor
Parameters:
visitable - Visited node.

afterVisit

public void afterVisit(Visitable visitable)
Also "climbs" all rows in the current level and sets a "|" to parent nodes id appropriate. Decrements the level until it reaches 0.

Specified by:
afterVisit in interface Visitor
Parameters:
visitable - visited node.

getText

public String getText()
Concatenates the matrix columns and rows adn returns the ASCII formatted text. After all visiting is done this method only generates the string once and memoizes the result.

Returns:
string
